newsitem.title: USA: Neogen to meet or exceed estimates.
newsitem.headline: Neogen to meet or exceed estimates.

text.p: Neogen Corp said it expects to meet or exceed consensus Wall Street estimates that it will earn $0.06 a share in the fourth quarter and $0.30 a share in the 1997 fiscal year ended May 31.
Neogen also said its board has authorized the repurchase of up to 250,000 shares of the company's common stock.
In the year ago fourth quarter, Neogen reported a loss of $0.14 a share. It posted a loss of $0.05 a share for the 1996 fiscal year.

Neogen said the shares will be repurchased on the open market or in negotiated transactions, depending upon market conditions and other factors. Accordingly, there is no guarantee as to the exact number of shares to be repurchased, the company said.

"Management and the Board of Directors believe that the Company's shares are undervalued from time to time by the market," Neogen Chief Financial Officer Lon Bohannon said in a statement. "We have just completed a record breaking year in terms of revenues and earnings, but we don't believe this performance has been reflected in our stock price."
Neogen currently produces and markets more than 140 different diagnostic tests for detection of natural toxins, drug residues, pesticides, microorganisms and plant diseases.
